intro: Esterhuysenia knysnana, commonly known as the Knysna estuarine reed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in brackish or freshwater wetlands, often found in estuaries and marshy areas. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered together, forming dense vegetation that stabilizes the surrounding soil. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
